intro: Eriosynaphe cachroides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands. The plant features slender, erect stems that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces a milky sap that is characteristic of the Asclepiadaceae family. Eriosynaphe cachroides is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
